DOC.brief_summary: The primary goal of this study is evaluate T cell immune status and immune reconstitution and the association with specific cytokines in patients with newly diagnosed HGGs undergoing the standard RT/TMZ and adjuvant TMZ.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of T-cell Immune Status in Patients With Newly Diagnosed High Grade Gliomas
DOC.detailed_description: Numbers of T-cell subtypes at six time points in patients with newly diagnosed HGGs undergoing standard RT/TMZ and adjuvant TMZ: 1. Baseline within 2 weeks before initiation of RT/TMZ 2. At the end of RT/TMZ approximately week 6 3. Before adjuvant TMZ approximately week 10 4. After 2 cycle of TMZ approximately week 18 5. After 4 cycle of TMZ approximately week 26 6. Three month after last cycle of TMZ Secondary Endpoints 1. Changes in serial T cell subtypes and cytokines levels 2. Incidence of lymphopenia related infections 3. Changes in T-cell numbers and subtypes with TMZ administration 4. Overall survival
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients must be at least 18 years of age. 2. Patients must have histologically confirmed new diagnosed high grade glioma by pathology (WHO grade III and IV). 3. Patients proposed postoperative treatment plan must include standard radiation and temozolomide. 4.
